intro: Cremanthodium wumengshanicum, commonly known as the Wumeng mountain corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in the spring. The plant features basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
